special_programs: Technasium - technology-focused program with hands-on learning and research
Topsport Talentschool - athletic development with integrated sports training
Passend Onderwijs - tailored support including dyslexia and gifted students

facilities.classrooms_labs_quality: Separate facilities and study areas for first and second-year students

technology.blended_learning: Laptops and digital materials integrated with textbooks

environment.culture_values: Nearly 60-year institutional history. Part of Stichting Progresso. Emphasizes technology, sports, and arts through specialized programs. Blended learning approach combining traditional and digital methods.

public_transport.accessibility_info: tram 1, 17, bus 61, 63 en 69 halte Meer en Vaart of Louis Davidsstraat

links: LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube, Facebook: Calandlyceum Amsterdam
admission_info: Voorrangsregels: voorrang voor kinderen van personeelsleden die op 1 oktober 2016 in dienst waren van het schoolbestuur, voor leerlingen van een daltonbasisschool en/of topsportleerlingen met een LOOT-status
Toelating: sporttest voor sportklas, beoordeling creatieve vaardigheden, samenwerking, motivatie en gedrag voor kunstklas, gesprek met basisschool over motivatie voor technasiumklas

strengths: Three specialized programs: Technasium (technology), Topsport Talentschool (athletics), Kunstatelier (arts)
Passend Onderwijs with support for dyslexia and gifted students
Blended learning with digital and traditional methods
considerations: Located in Amsterdam Nieuw-West - commute from Amstelveen required
Multiple specialized programs may make choosing track complex
Topsport program requires significant athletic commitment
best_fit_for: Students interested in technology and research (Technasium)
Student athletes seeking integrated sports training (Topsport)
Students with dyslexia or gifted students needing tailored support
Families valuing established school with long history
Students who benefit from blended learning approaches
ai_analysis.summary: Calandlyceum is an established school (nearly 60 years) in Amsterdam Nieuw-West offering VMBO-T, HAVO, and VWO education with three distinctive specialized programs: Technasium (technology focus), Topsport Talentschool (integrated athletic training), and Kunstatelier (arts curriculum). Part of Stichting Progresso, the school provides Passend Onderwijs support for dyslexia and gifted students, uses blended learning approaches, and offers a mentor system for guidance. With separate facilities for younger students, an on-campus library, healthy canteen, and diverse extracurriculars (theater, kart racing, debate, sports), Calandlyceum caters to students with varied interests and abilities.
